meanings.definition: Write or draw carelessly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: She was scribbling notes in her notebook during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The child was scribbling with crayons on the walls.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't read her scribbling handwriting on the post-it note.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hand moved like lightning, scribbling across the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The student was caught scribbling answers on the desk during the exam.

meanings.definition: A piece of writing or drawing done carelessly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: The table was covered in scribbling from the toddler's markers.
meanings.sent2: She found an old notebook filled with scribbling from her childhood.
meanings.sent3: The detective struggled to make sense of the scribbling in the suspect's journal.
meanings.sent4: The walls of the cave were covered in ancient scribbling from long ago.
meanings.sent5: The teacher praised the student's creative scribbling in the margins of the assignment.
